data.name: Temple of Starlight
data.detailed_description:
Temple of Starlight is a first-person puzzle game that stands out with its unique visual style and non-linear narrative. Make your way down to the depths of the temple by manipulating lights and colors, and lead a falling civilization through the starlight crisis.

Temple of Starlight offers 30 different puzzles, resulting in over an hour of gameplay time. While prioritizing quality over quantity, we strive for this to be a short, but pleasant experience.

NON-LINEAR NARRATIVE - MAKE YOUR CHOICE


Explore an event from the ancient Saasil civilization, where they encountered a natural disaster of the stars fading, and their most crucial resource – starlight (energy collected from the stars) – became inaccessible.

The three rulers Red, Green, and Blue were destined to tackle the starlight disaster and protect their people. You are directly involved in the story progression by making meaningful choices as you progress through the levels.

MIX ADDITIVE COLORS


The main mechanics of the game include manipulating three primary colors of light - red, green, and blue. Test your skills of additive colors by enabling, rotating, and mixing these lights to adjust colored objects.

RETRO VISUAL STYLE


Immerse yourself in an abstract environment with vibrant colors and mystical structures. Unique visuals are enhanced by a completely original musical score and sound effects.

ACCESSIBILITY FEATURES

We want to make the puzzle-solving experience pleasant for everyone. More accessibility features are in development, while these are currently available:
  • Brightness and contrast settings to adjust visuals.
  • Subtitles for narration.

data.short_description: Temple of Starlight is an abstract first-person puzzle game with a unique striking retro visual style. Use colored lights to clear obstacles and explore an ancient temple along with its forgotten history.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-9300H
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660 Ti
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
  • Additional Notes: Most likely supports lower end setups, but it hasn't been tested yet
